subsc: General industry and trade sector,Other industry,Power,Oil and gas,General education sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The Gabonese Government's economic
            and social program has launched a set of macroeconomic,
            structural and social policies to accompany the devaluation
            of the franc of Central Africa. The Government's
            program aims at restoring the competitiveness of the
            Gabonese economy and laying the basis for growth and poverty
            alleviation. The Government has already taken a series of
            key measures to restore competitiveness and stabilize the
            public finances. The main measures already taken are: a) the
            adjustment of the parity of the currency; b) limiting wage
            increases in the public sector; c) a reduction and
            simplification of the imports tariff, and the implementation
            of a preferential tariff in favor of imports from the
            countries of the Central African Custom Union; d) a
            reduction of the taxes on fuel; e) the preparation of a
            revised Draft Budget Law for 1994 that provides for a
            reallocation of funds to the social sectors, the elimination
            of export taxes on exports other than wood and mineral
            products, the elimination of some customs exemptions, and
            the introduction of a value added tax. The Economic Recovery
            Loan Project is designed to support the implementation of
            these measures as well as a reform towards more efficient
            pricing of energy and a further liberalization of trade.
